Wiki of the Studio Dorbel portal (this wiki is not a movie project)
=What is Studio Dorbel?=
Studio Dorbel is an online collaborative studio aiming at making open short movies.
The project is open to everyone and entirely online.
Participants from all over the world collaborate around computer generated movie projects, everyone brings his talent.
Only free software and open standards are used, any resource, including the final result, is licensed under CC-BY.
It can be considered as the Wikipedia of computer generated short movies.
=News=
''here news from the Studio Dorbel portal''
=Current Projects= * [{{SERVER}}/capoda2 CAPODA 2]
=Community=
==Organisation== A node on [http://studiodorbel.status.net/ status.net] has been set up to facilitate communication. It's a microblogging site dedicated to Studio Dorbel (a twitter, but with messages only concerning our project). Create an account (or get federated?).
==How does it work?== STUDIO DORBEL is based on a flexible [[data structure]]. If you need Help when using it, please refer to the See [[Help:Contents|Help]] pages.
Open source [[tools]] are used to make the movies.
Learn more about the [[technology]] behind the plateform. ==Contribute==
===What needs to be done?=== Check the [[TODO]] page.
===Decisions=== * [[Version control]] system.
===Have ideas to improve Studio Dorbel?=== Please expose them in the [[Ideas]] section.
===Important=== If you modify your project Templates and think your modifications may be useful for other projects, see the page [[Help:Export Your Templates]]

MediaWiki is used as a wiki engine to provide the basics of the collaborative website.
Semantic MediaWiki is used because it allows to work on a flexible data structure. It add forms and semantic power to MediaWiki, this is perfect for manipulating movie data.
Movie files are versionned into a [[Version control]] system.

The main artistic tool is [http://www.blender.org Blender]. Blender files are object oriented, which is fully adapted to this kind of project, for example, a scene file can link to two character files, data is not copied, but linked.
2D files will be created using GIMP, Inkscape, MyPaint for example
Music will be mixed using Ardour
online libraries of assets (music, soud effects, textures, 3D objects...)

=Choice= The chosen version control system has to be easy to use.
* For most people, a decentralized workflow is too complicated. The version control system has to allow centralized workflow (such as SVN). * It needs to have a User Interface on Windows, Mac and Linux.
=Hosting= External hosting seams to be a better solution than self hosting, for costs and administration reasons. (to be discussed)
The main point is that data size can be very big.
==[http://code.google.com/hosting/ Google Code Project Hosting]==
SVN and Mercurial
[http://code.google.com/p/support/wiki/FAQ#Hosted_Tools there are limits] ([http://groups.google.com/group/google-code-hosting/browse_thread/thread/3dda14faed174a47?pli=1 apparently] '''1GB'''). but can be freely increased if "(1) the request is reasonable, (2) you're not doing ridiculous things that waste disk space."
==[http://github.com/ Github]== Git
no limit for free (GitHub does not have any hard storage limits. We have soft limits for each plan to prevent abuse).

1 GB limit for free

The project files are versionned using a tool called SVN.
You can download the files of a project on your machine. You can modify them locally but in order to share them with the other members, you have to get an authorization (login and passowrd).
=On Windows= ==Installation== Download and install [http://tortoisesvn.tigris.org/ Tortoise SVN].
